profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in NoteTab Pro. Encoded by Jasmine Jones. 2015-07-30

did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: The records of the Prison Birth Project is comprised of correspondence, newsletters, and other publications related to midwifery and the Prison Birth Project.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 2008 by Lisa Andrews and Marianne Bullock (Smith College ACS 2014), the Prison Birth Project "works within a reproductive justice framework to provide support, advocacy, and leadership training with women and trans* people at the intersection of the criminal justice system and parenthood" ( http://theprisonbirthproject.org/about/). In 2011, the Western Massachusetts-based organization transformed itself into a collective, adopting a leadership circle that operates by consensus. Their services include doula and breastfeeding support, childbirth education, and advocacy for incarcerated women and their families.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The records of the Prison Birth Project is comprised of correspondence, newsletters, and other publications related to midwifery and the Prison Birth Project. Also included is the 2011 Prison Birth Project annual report.
[NOTE: The contents list for this collection is not online. Contact the Sophia Smith Collection if you would like one sent to you.]

accessrestrict.p:
The papers are open to research according to the regulations of the Sophia Smith Collection with the following caveat:
This collection has not been fully processed and therefore may be difficult to use.

userestrict.p: The Sophia Smith Collection owns copyright to the records of this organization. Permission must be obtained to publish reproductions or quotations beyond "fair use." Copyright to materials created by others may be owned by those individuals or their heirs or assigns. It is the responsibility of the researcher to identify and satisfy the holders of all copyrights.

prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Prison Birth Project Records, Sophia Smith Collection, Smith College, Northampton, Mass.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to collection are expected and may not be reflected in this record.

acqinfo.p: The Prison Birth Project Records were donated to the Sophia Smith Collection in 2014.
